headline: Kroger removes Russian-produced vodka from shelves
sentences: The Ohio Division of Liquor Control has also directed that the 487 liquor agencies across the state pull “Green Mark Vodka” and “Russian Standard Vodka” from their shelves immediately.
Mike DeWine ordered the state’s Department of Commerce to cease the purchase and sale of all vodka made by the Russian company Russian Standard Vodka.
Kroger added emergency food assistance will be set to support refugees and they will match all gifts made by associates and customers up to $250,000.
According to DeWine, Russian Standard Vodka is the only overseas, Russian-owned vodka distillery with vodka sold in the state.
The Cincinnati-based grocer joins a slew of others in removing Russian-produced vodka the country invaded Ukraine.
COLUMBUS, Ohio — Kroger has announced it has pulled Russian-produced vodka from its shelves in support of Ukraine.
In a tweet posted on Tuesday, the grocery store chain said the products were removed over the weekend.
